[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

Here are examples of records:
Female,45.2,1,0,never,28.5,6.2,140,0
Male,62.7,1,1,former,32.1,7.1,185,1
Female,38.9,0,0,current,24.3,5.8,130,0
Female,22.0,0,0,never,25.77,4.0,145,0
Male,58.0,0,0,former,36.53,5.8,160,0
Male,11.0,0,0,No Info,27.59,6.6,100,0 [/INST] Here are some synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following the given format:

Female, 53.5, 0, 0, never, 29.2, 5.5, 155, 0
Male, 71.3, 1, 1, former, 31.8, 7.3, 210, 1
Female, 41.1, 1, 0, current, 33.4, 6.1, 195, 0
Male, 56.2, 0, 1, never, 27.9, 4.5, 120, 1
Female, 28.5, 0, 0, former, 22.1, 5.9, 152, 0
Male, 87.6, 0, 1, current, 30.1, 8.2, 175, 1
Female, 65.8, 1, 0, never, 25.6, 4.8, 135, 0
Male, 45.3, 1, 1, former, 35.7, 6.8, 188, 1
Female, 32.1, 0, 0, current, 26.0, 5.2, 142, 0
Male, 68.7, 0, 0, never, 28.9, 5.1, 165, 0

These records include a mix of genders, ages, and health conditions, with some patients having diabetes and others not. The BMI, HbA1c_level, and blood_glucose_level values are within the given range.

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

Here are examples of records:
Female,45.2,1,0,never,28.5,6.2,140,0
Male,62.7,1,1,former,32.1,7.1,185,1
Female,38.9,0,0,current,24.3,5.8,130,0
Female,22.0,0,0,never,25.77,4.0,145,0
Male,58.0,0,0,former,36.53,5.8,160,0
Male,11.0,0,0,No Info,27.59,6.6,100,0 [/INST] Here are some synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction:

Female, 53.4, 0, 0, never, 29.2, 5.5, 125, 0
Male, 71.3, 1, 0, former, 31.8, 7.3, 220, 0
Female, 47.1, 1, 1, current, 35.1, 6.8, 155, 1
Male, 65.5, 0, 1, never, 28.6, 4.5, 188, 0
Female, 28.9, 0, 0, former, 21.9, 5.1, 110, 0
Male, 55.7, 0, 1, current, 30.3, 8.1, 195, 1
Female, 36.5, 1, 0, never, 23.6, 4.9, 132, 0
Male, 89.2, 1, 1, former, 35.4, 6.9, 250, 1
Female, 42.1, 0, 0, current, 27.8, 5.7, 148, 0
Male, 51.6, 0, 0, never, 26.3, 4.8, 170, 0

These records represent a mix of genders, ages, BMI, smoking history, hypertension, heart disease, HbA1c levels, blood glucose levels, and diabetes status. Note that these records are synthetic and do not represent real patients.

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

Here are examples of records:
Female,45.2,1,0,never,28.5,6.2,140,0
Male,62.7,1,1,former,32.1,7.1,185,1
Female,38.9,0,0,current,24.3,5.8,130,0
Female,22.0,0,0,never,25.77,4.0,145,0
Male,58.0,0,0,former,36.53,5.8,160,0
Male,11.0,0,0,No Info,27.59,6.6,100,0 [/INST] Here are five synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following the given format:

1. Female, 53.4, 0, 0, never, 29.1, 5.5, 125, 0
2. Male, 71.3, 1, 1, former, 35.6, 7.3, 200, 1
3. Female, 41.2, 1, 0, current, 33.4, 6.1, 175, 1
4. Male, 55.5, 0, 1, never, 26.8, 4.5, 150, 0
5. Female, 28.7, 0, 0, not current, 23.2, 5.0, 115, 0

These records represent various patient profiles, including different genders, ages, BMI, smoking histories, and health conditions, as well as both diagnosed and undiagnosed diabetes cases.

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

[INST] You are a synthetic medical data generator. Generate realistic patient records for diabetes research.

Generate realistic synthetic patient records for diabetes prediction following this format:
1. gender: Patient's gender (Male/Female)
2. age: Patient's age in years (Float: 0.0-100.0)
3. hypertension: Whether patient has hypertension (0: No, 1: Yes)
4. heart_disease: Whether patient has heart disease (0: No, 1: Yes)
5. smoking_history: Patient's smoking history (never/former/current/not current)
6. bmi: Body Mass Index, measure of body fat based on weight and height (Float: 15.0-60.0)
7. HbA1c_level: Hemoglobin A1c level, measure of average blood sugar over past 3 months (Float: 4.0-9.0)
8. blood_glucose_level: Current blood glucose level in mg/dL (Integer: 70-300)
9. diabetes: Whether patient has diabetes (0: No, 1: Yes)

Here are examples of records:
Female,45.2,1,0,never,28.5,6.2,140,0
Male,62.7,1,1,former,32.1,7.1,185,1
Female,38.9,0,0,current,24.3,5.8,130,0
Female,22.0,0,0,never,25.77,4.0,145,0
Male,58.0,0,0,former,36.53,5.8,160,0
Male,11.0,0,0,No Info,27.59,6.6,100,0 [/INST] Here are ten synthetic patient records following the given format for diabetes prediction:

1. Female, 52.3, 0, 0, never, 27.8, 5.5, 125, 0
2. Male, 71.5, 1, 1, former, 31.2, 7.4, 210, 1
3. Female, 43.6, 1, 0, current, 33.4, 6.1, 155, 1
4. Male, 55.1, 0, 0, never, 26.9, 4.9, 110, 0
5. Female, 29.7, 0, 1, former, 28.1, 5.7, 135, 0
6. Male, 88.6, 1, 1, current, 29.6, 8.2, 195, 1
7. Female, 35.8, 0, 0, never, 23.2, 4.5, 120, 0
8. Male, 68.3, 0, 0, former, 34.5, 6.3, 175, 0
9. Female, 49.1, 1, 1, current, 31.1, 7.2, 165, 1
10. Male, 51.6, 0, 0, never, 25.3, 4.8, 150, 0

These records have randomized values for each attribute, keeping in mind the given constraints. The presence or absence of conditions and attributes are also randomized to ensure diversity.
